'The Table', sometimes called 'Table Mountain', is a high flow-dominated
andesite tuya located south of Garibaldi Lake, northeast of Cheekye and north of
Mount Garibaldi, British Columbia, Canada. It rises over above the surface of
Garibaldi Lake, which lies less than to the north.

The Table is almost impossible to climb because sections of the volcano have
collapsed, creating steep and exceptionally rotten rock walls on all sides.
